text: Az ír kocsmák világát idéző sör. Ahogy illik úgy itatja magát. Amikor csapon van, akkor mindig iszok belőle.
On tap in Budapest. Semi-dark ale with soft aroma of oranges and higher bitterness, dry and very drinkable.
On tap at hopaholic. Nice red colour small white head. Nose is fruity. Taste is intense hoppy bitterness maybe a bit too much. Otherwise nice.
On tap @ Fozdefeszt. I did not take notes while drinking this one therefore this entry is based on numerical notes only.

On tap @ Csakajósör - Slightly hazy, deep reddish amber colour, large, stable beige head, fine lacing. Hoppy and toffee nose with some lemon zest, biscuit, touch of honey. Taste is syrupy sweet with a lot of caramel, dried fruits, peach, grapefruit and decent citrussy and resinous hop bitterness. Medium body and carbonation, sticky mouthfeel, long bitter finish. Excellent IPA with astonishing amounts of hops, signature brew.

On tap @ Csak a Jó Sör - Color: dark amber beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: high hoppy nose, really fresh with grassy notes and cereals well balanced. Taste: nice fruity taste with grassy hoppy! Really nice! Aftertaste: wet bitterness !

On tap. Deep amber body, white head. Both the aroma and the taste have huge citrusy notes, pine, caramel and some toast. The aftertaste is a bit more piney than what the aroma suggests. I cant really get the maple syrup, but I dont mind, its still awesome.
Ez egy igen jól sikerült sör, kellemes és karakteres ízvilága van számomra. Három korsó elfogyasztása után stabil kedvencnek tűnik. Gratula!

Nice, sweet, medium body with less nose but more intense taste, caramell, marple syrup, honey, little citrus, long lasting bitterness. It is a nice, well-balanced beer. Irish beer with IPA properties.

A real treat from armando_otchoa. On tap at csakajosor. At first you think youre just getting a hoppy red but then the sticky sweet maple syrup notes come in and its a mash up of citrusy bitter hops and molasses syrup. damn good stuff!

beautiful appearance of reddish amber colour and huge, stable, creamy yellowish head; aroma is not so intensive - piney, citrusy hops and some syrupy-caramel notes; great taste of citruses, piney notes, malty sweetness; bitter aftertaste; amazing beer
